003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

007 * All rights reserved. Visit https://imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 *******************************************************************************/
009
010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
014
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * This class represents complex numbers. All instances are immutable. Methods
020 * are mostly defined to be compatible with
021 * org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex and (newer)
022 * org.apache.commons.numbers.complex.Complex. Arithmetic operations are
023 * generally more precise than with the Apache implementation. See also Appendix
024 * Sec. A.5 of [1].
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
028 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/07/05
033 */
034public class Complex {
035        
036        /** Constant - real unit value (z = 1 + i 0). */
037        public static final Complex ONE = new Complex(1, 0);
038        /** Constant - complex zero value (z = 0 + i 0). */
039        public static final Complex ZERO = new Complex(0, 0);
040        /** Constant -  imaginary unit value (z = 0 + i 1). */
041        public static final Complex I = new Complex(0, 1);
042
043        /** The real part of this complex number (publicly accessible but read-only). */
044        public final double re;
045        /** The imaginary part of this complex number (publicly accessible but read-only). */
046        public final double im;
047
048        /**
049         * Constructor.
050         * @param re real part
051         * @param im imaginary part
052         */
053        public Complex(double re, double im) {
054                this.re = re;
055                this.im = im;
056        }
057        
058        /**
059         * Constructor.
060         * @param z a two-element {@code double} array with real and imaginary part
061         */
062        public Complex(double[] z) {
063                this(z[0], z[1]);
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * Constructor.
068         * @param z complex quantity, which is duplicated
069         */
070        public Complex(Complex z) {
071                this.re = z.re;
072                this.im = z.im;
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Constructor, creates a complex quantity on the unit circle with angle {@code phi}:
077         * {@code e^(i * phi) = cos(phi) + i * sin(phi)}.
078         * @param phi the angle
079         * @see #arg()
080         */
081        public Complex(double phi) {
082                this.re = Math.cos(phi);
083                this.im = Math.sin(phi);
084        }
085        
086        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
087
088        /**
089         * Returns the absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
090         * its radius or distance from the origin.
091         * @return the absolute value
092         */
093        public double abs() {
094                return Math.hypot(re, im);
095        }
096
097        /**
098         * Returns the squared absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
099         * its squared radius or distance from the origin.
100         * @return the squared absolute value
101         */
102        public double abs2() {
103                return sqr(re) + sqr(im);
104        }
105
106        /**
107         * Returns the 'argument' of this complex number, i.e.,
108         * its angle w.r.t. to the real axis. 
109         * @return the argument (in radians)
110         */
111        public double arg() {
112                return Math.atan2(im, re);
113        }
114
115        /**
116     * Returns the conjugate {@code z*} of this complex number, i.e,
117     * if {@code z = a + i b} then {@code z* = a - i b}.
118     * @return the complex conjugate
119     */
120        public Complex conjugate() {
121                return new Complex(this.re, -this.im);
122        }
123
124        /**
125         * Adds a complex quantity to this complex number and returns
126         * a new complex number.
127         * @param z complex value
128         * @return the sum of this complex number and {@code z}
129         */
130        public Complex add(Complex z) {
131                return new Complex(this.re + z.re,  this.im + z.im);
132        }
133
134        /**
135         * Rotates this complex number by angle {@code phi} and returns
136         * the resulting complex number.
137         * @param phi the angle (in radians)
138         * @return the rotated complex value
139         */
140        public Complex rotate(double phi) {
141                return this.multiply(new Complex(phi));
142        }
143
144        @Override
145    public String toString() {
146        return String.format(Locale.US, "(%.9f, %.9f)", re, im);
147    }
148        
149    /**
150     * Returns true if the real or imaginary component of this complex number
151     * is {@code NaN}.
152     * @return true if {@code NaN}, otherwise false
153     */
154        public boolean isNaN() {
155                return Double.isNaN(this.getRe()) || Double.isNaN(this.getIm());
156        }
157        
158        /**
159         * Returns the real part of this complex number.
160         * @return the real part
161         */
162        public double getRe() {
163                return this.re;
164        }
165        
166        /**
167         * Returns the imaginary part of this complex number.
168         * @return the imaginary part
169         */
170        public double getIm() {
171                return this.im;
172        }
173
174        // -------------------------------------------------------
175        
176        /**
177         * Multiplies this complex number with another complex quantity and returns
178         * a new complex number.
179         * @param z a complex quantity
180         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code z}
181         */
182        public Complex multiply(Complex z) {
183                // (x1 + i y1)(x2 + i y2) = (x1 x2 + y1 y2) + i (x1 y2 + y1 x2)
184                final double x = this.re * z.re - this.im * z.im;
185                final double y = this.re * z.im + this.im * z.re;
186                return new Complex(x, y);
187        }
188        
189        /**
190         * Multiplies this complex number with the scalar factor {@code s} and returns
191         * a new complex number.
192         * @param s a scalar factor
193         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code s}
194         */
195        public Complex multiply(double s) {
196                return new Complex(this.re * s, this.im * s);
197        }
198        
199         /**
200     * Returns of value of this complex number ({@code z}) raised to the power {@code k}
201     * (integer).
202     * @param k the integer exponent (&ge; 0)
203     * @return {@code z^k}
204     */
205        public Complex pow(int k) {
206                if (k < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("exponent k >= 0 expected");
207                Complex prod = new Complex(1, 0);
208                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
209                        prod = prod.multiply(this);
210                }
211                return prod;
212        }
213        
214        /**
215         * Returns a 2-element array with the real and imaginary part of this
216         * complex number.
217         * @return (re, im)
218         */
219        public double[] toArray() {
220                return new double[] {this.re, this.im};
221        }
222
223        /**
224         * Checks if the given {@link Object} is equal to
225         * this {@link Complex} quantity.
226         * Calls {@link #equals(Complex, double)} if the argument is
227         * of type {@link Complex}, otherwise {@code null} is returned.
228         */
229        @Override
230        public boolean equals(Object other) {
231        if (other == this) {
232            return true;
233        }       
234        if (other instanceof Complex) {
235//              final Complex z = (Complex) other;
236//              return Double.compare(this.re, z.re) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, z.im) == 0;
237                return this.equals((Complex) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
238        }
239        return false;
240        }
241        
242        /**
243         * Checks if the given {@link Complex} quantity is equal to
244         * this {@link Complex} quantity.
245         * 
246         * @param z another {@link Complex} quantity
247         * @param tolerance the maximum difference of real and imaginary parts
248         * @return true if the two complex quantities are sufficiently close, false otherwise
249         */
250        public boolean equals(Complex z, double tolerance) {
251                return isZero(this.re - z.re, tolerance) 
252                                && isZero(this.im - z.im, tolerance);
253        }
254        
255        /**
256         * Checks if the given complex quantity is equal to
257         * this {@link Complex} quantity, using the default tolerance
258         * ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
259         * 
260         * @param re real part of other complex quantity
261         * @param im imaginary part of other complex quantity
262         * @return true if the two complex quantities are sufficiently close, false otherwise
263         */
264        public boolean equals(double re, double im) {
265                //return Double.compare(this.re, re) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, im) == 0;
266                return this.equals(re, im, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
267        }
268        
269        /**
270         * Checks if the given complex quantity is equal to
271         * this {@link Complex} quantity, using the specified tolerance.
272         * 
273         * @param re real part of other complex quantity
274         * @param im imaginary part of other complex quantity
275         * @param tolerance the maximum difference of real and imaginary parts
276         * @return true if the two complex quantities are sufficiently close, false otherwise
277         */
278        public boolean equals(double re, double im, double tolerance) {
279                return isZero(this.re - re, tolerance) 
280                                && isZero(this.im - im, tolerance);
281        }
282        
283        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
284        
285}
